subject: Draft and Recruitment (Sports)
lead_paragraph: Jordan Palmer signed a two-year deal with the Cincinnati Bengals on Wednesday that will give him a chance to play behind his brother, quarterback Carson Palmer, who was the No. 1 pick in the 2003 draft. Jordan Palmer, who is five years younger, set school records at Texas-El Paso by throwing for 11,084 yards and 88 touchdowns. Washington drafted him in the sixth round last year, but he was waived Sept. 1.
